# Documentation: rformat

## format_blank_lines

### Format Blank Lines

#### Description

Normalize blank lines between code blocks.

#### Usage

```r
format_blank_lines(code)
```

#### Arguments

- **`code`**: Code string.

#### Value

Code with normalized blank lines.


## format_line_tokens

### Format Tokens on a Single Line

#### Description

Format Tokens on a Single Line

#### Usage

```r
format_line_tokens(tokens)
```

#### Arguments

- **`tokens`**: Data frame of tokens for one line.

#### Value

Formatted line content (no leading whitespace).


## format_line

### Format a Single Line

#### Description

Apply formatting rules to a single line of code.

#### Usage

```r
format_line(line)
```

#### Arguments

- **`line`**: Character string of a single line.

#### Value

Formatted line.


## format_parsed

### Format Parsed R Code

#### Description

Internal function to format parsed R expressions.

#### Usage

```r
format_parsed(parsed, original)
```

#### Arguments

- **`parsed`**: Parsed R expression from parse().
- **`original`**: Original code string for reference.

#### Value

Formatted code as character string.


## format_spacing

### Format Spacing

#### Description

Apply spacing rules to code.

#### Usage

```r
format_spacing(code)
```

#### Arguments

- **`code`**: Code string.

#### Value

Code with corrected spacing.


## format_tokens

### Format R Code Using Token-Based Parsing

#### Description

Internal function to format R code using getParseData tokens. Preserves
original indentation, applies spacing rules to code tokens.

#### Usage

```r
format_tokens(code)
```

#### Arguments

- **`code`**: Character string of R code.

#### Value

Formatted code as character string.


## needs_space

### Determine If Space Needed Between Tokens

#### Description

Determine If Space Needed Between Tokens

#### Usage

```r
needs_space(prev, tok)
```

#### Arguments

- **`prev`**: Previous token (data frame row).
- **`tok`**: Current token (data frame row).

#### Value

Logical.


## rformat_dir

### Format R Files in Directory

#### Description

Format all R files in a directory.

#### Usage

```r
rformat_dir(path = ".", recursive = TRUE, dry_run = FALSE)
```

#### Arguments

- **`path`**: Path to directory.
- **`recursive`**: If TRUE, process subdirectories.
- **`dry_run`**: If TRUE, report changes without writing.

#### Value

Invisibly returns vector of modified file paths.


## rformat_file

### Format R File

#### Description

Format an R file in place or write to a new file.

#### Usage

```r
rformat_file(path, output = NULL, dry_run = FALSE)
```

#### Arguments

- **`path`**: Path to R file.
- **`output`**: Optional output path. If NULL, overwrites input file.
- **`dry_run`**: If TRUE, return formatted code without writing.

#### Value

Invisibly returns formatted code.


## rformat

### Format R Code

#### Description

Format R code string according to base R style conventions.

#### Usage

```r
rformat(code)
```

#### Arguments

- **`code`**: Character string of R code to format.

#### Value

Formatted code as a character string.

#### Examples

```r
rformat("x<-1+2")
rformat("if(x>0){y<-1}")
```


## spacing_before

### Determine Spacing Before Token

#### Description

Determine Spacing Before Token

#### Usage

```r
spacing_before(tok, prev)
```

#### Arguments

- **`tok`**: Current token row.
- **`prev`**: Previous token row or NULL.

#### Value

Logical, TRUE if space needed before token.
